com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface Array

  • All Superinterfaces:
    XMLDecoder

    public interface Array
extends XMLDecoder
    A UPA Array is a uniform primitive type that can contain 0 to N simple primitive entries,u where zero entries indicates an empty Array.

    Each Array entry can house only simple primitive types such as Int, Real, or Date. An array entry cannot house any container types or other Array types. This is a uniform type, where primitiveType() indicates the single, simple primitive type of each entry.

    Array uses simple replacement rules for change management. When new entries are added, or any array entry requires a modification, all entries must be sent with the Array. This new Array entirely replaces any previously stored or displayed data.

    An Array entry can be encoded from pre-encoded data or by encoding individual pieces of data as provided. The Array does not use a specific entry structure. When encoding, the application passes a pointer to the primitive type value (when data is not encoded) or a Buffer (containing the pre-encoded primitive).

    Example: Encoding of Array

    The following code example demonstrates how to encode an Array. The array is set to encode unsigned integer entries, where the entries have a fixed length of two bytes each. The example encodes two array entries. The first entry is encoded from a primitive UInt type; the second entry is encoded from a Buffer containing a pre-encoded UInt type. 

    •  int retval;
 // Create Array using CodecFactory
 Array array = CodecFactory.createArray();
 
 // Populate array prior to calling encodeInit()
 array.primitiveType(DataTypes.UINT);
 array.itemLength(2);
 
 if (array.encodeInit(encIter) < CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS)
 {
     // error condition
 }
 else
 {
     // encode first entry from a UInt from a primitive type
     retval = uint.encode(encIter);
 
     // encode second entry from a UInt from pre-encoded integer contained in a
     // buffer. This buffer.data should point to encoded int and the length
     // should be number of bytes encoded.
     retval = preencodedUint.encode(encIter);
 }
 
 // Complete array encoding. If success parameter is true, this will finalize
 // encoding.
 // If success parameter is false, this will roll back encoding prior to
 // encodeArrayInit
 
 retval = array.encodeComplete(encIter, success);

    Example: Decoding of Array

    The following example decodes an Array and each of its entries to the primitive value. This sample code assumes the contained primitive type is a UInt. Typically an application invokes the specific primitive decoder for the contained type or uses a switch statement to allow for a more generic array entry decoder. This example uses the same DecodeIterator when calling the primitive decoder method. An application could optionally use a new DecodeIterator by setting the encoded entry buffer on a new iterator. To simplify the example, some error handling is omitted. 

    •  int retval;
 
  //decode array
 if (array.decode(decIter) >= CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS)
 {
    //decode array entry
    while((retval = arrayentry.decode(decIter, entrybuffer)) != CodecReturnCodes.END_OF_CONTAINER)
    {
          if(retval < CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS)
          {
              //decoding failure tends to be unrecoverable
          }
          else
          {
              // decode array entry into primitive type 
              // we can use the same decode iterator, or set the encoded
              // entry buffer onto a new iterator 
              retval = uInt.decode(decIter);
          }
    }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Sets all members in Array to an initial value. Useful for object reuse during encoding. While decoding, Array object can be reused without using clear().

      • isBlank

        boolean isBlank()
        Is Array blank.

      • encodeInit

        int encodeInit(EncodeIterator iter)
        Prepares array for encoding. Typical use:
        1. Call Array.encodeInit()
        2. Call ArrayEntry.encode() for each entry using the same buffer
        3. Call Array.encodeComplete()
        Parameters:
        iter - The encoder iterator.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes
        See Also:
        EncodeIterator

      • encodeComplete

        int encodeComplete(EncodeIterator iter,
                   boolean success)
        Completes array encoding. Typical use:
        1. Call Array.encodeInit()
        2. Call ArrayEntry.encode() for each entry using the same buffer
        3. Call Array.encodeComplete()
        Parameters:
        iter - The encoder iterator.
        success - If true - successfully complete the aggregate, if false - remove the aggregate from the buffer.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes
        See Also:
        EncodeIterator

      • decode

        int decode(DecodeIterator iter)
        Decode an array.
        Parameters:
        iter - The decoder iterator.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes
        See Also:
        DecodeIterator

      • primitiveType

        int primitiveType()
        Primitive type for all items in the array. primitiveType must be from the DataTypes enumeration.
        Returns:
        the primitiveType
        See Also:
        DataTypes

      • primitiveType

        void primitiveType(int primitiveType)
        Primitive type for all items in the array. primitiveType must be from the DataTypes enumeration and must be greater than DataTypes.UNKNOWN and less than or equals to DataTypes.BASE_PRIMITIVE_MAX. primitiveType cannot be DataTypes.ARRAY.
        Parameters:
        primitiveType - the primitiveType to set
        See Also:
        DataTypes

      • itemLength

        int itemLength()
        If items are fixed length populate length here - otherwise make 0 for length specified item encoding.
        Returns:
        the itemLength

      • itemLength

        void itemLength(int itemLength)
        If items are fixed length populate length here - otherwise make 0 for length specified item encoding. Must be in the range of 0 - 65535.
        Parameters:
        itemLength - the itemLength to set

      • encodedData

        Buffer encodedData()
        Raw data contents of the array. Set by decode() method during decode.
        Returns:
        the encodedData
        See Also:
        Buffer
